revised_title: Description of a Fossil Tusk of an Extinct Proboscidian Mammal from Queensland, Australia
tldr: The author describes a fossil tusk of an extinct proboscidian mammal (Notelephas australis) found in Queensland, Australia. The tusk is indicative of an elephantine animal, smaller than existing ones in Asia and Africa. The specimen was discovered by Mr. Fred. N. Isaac in a drift-deposit of a ravine in the Darling Downs district, sixty miles eastward of Moreton Bay, Queensland, Australia.
